Potential offspring with lowest combination of 'Predicted Rank' - 'DistanceCompensation' is selected as offspring. (For each TournamentWinner). Default: 0.2 * .

member.name: M:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.Configuration.AlgorithmTunerConfiguration.IsCompatible(Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.Configuration.ConfigurationBase)
member.summary: Checks whether two s are compatible for one to be used in a continued tuning based on a tuning using the other.
member.param: Configuration used for the start of tuning.
member.returns: True iff this configuration can be used for continued tuning.

member.name: M:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.Configuration.AlgorithmTunerConfiguration.IsTechnicallyCompatible(Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.Configuration.ConfigurationBase)
member.summary:
Checks whether two s are compatible in a technical sense for one to be used in a continued tuning based on a tuning using the other.
The difference to is that this function only checks for technical compatibility and does not consider whether the combination of configurations is compatible in the sense that the continued tuning looks like a longer single tuning.
member.param: Configuration used for the start of tuning.
member.returns: True iff this configuration can be used for continued tuning.

member.name: T:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.ContinuousOptimization.CovarianceMatrixAdaptation.TerminationCriteria.ConditionCov
member.summary:
Termination criterion for based on numerical stability: Stop if the condition number of the covariance matrix exceeds a certain number.
This criterion was defined in Auger A, Hansen N: A restart CMA evolution strategy with increasing population size. In Proceedings of the IEEE Congress on Evolutionary Computation, 2005.

member.summary: The maximum condition number which does not lead to termination.

member.summary: Checks whether the condition number of the covariance matrix exceeds .

member.remarks: For example, this method might set equality definitions in dictionaries.

member.summary: Restores an object after deserialization by .
member.remarks: For example, this method might set equality definitions in dictionaries.

member.name: T:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.ContinuousOptimization.CovarianceMatrixAdaptation.TerminationCriteria.NoEffectAxis
member.summary:
Termination criterion for based on numerical stability: Stop if adding a 0.1-standard deviation vector in any principal axis direction of the covariance matrix does not change the distribution mean.
This criterion was defined in Auger A, Hansen N: A restart CMA evolution strategy with increasing population size. In Proceedings of the IEEE Congress on Evolutionary Computation, 2005.

member.name: M:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.ContinuousOptimization.CovarianceMatrixAdaptation.TerminationCriteria.NoEffectAxis.IsMet(Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.ContinuousOptimization.CovarianceMatrixAdaptation.CmaEsElements)
member.summary:
Checks adding a 0.1-standard deviation vector in a principal axis direction of the covariance matrix does not change the distribution mean.
Axis is chosen dependent on generation.
member.returns: Whether no change occurred in distribution mean.

member.name: M:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.ContinuousOptimization.CovarianceMatrixAdaptation.TerminationCriteria.NoEffectAxis.Restore
member.summary: Restores an object after deserialization by .
member.remarks: For example, this method might set equality definitions in dictionaries.

member.name: T:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.ContinuousOptimization.CovarianceMatrixAdaptation.TerminationCriteria.NoEffectCoord
member.summary:
Termination criterion for based on numerical stability: Stop if adding a 0.2-standard deviation vector in any single coordinate does not change the distribution mean.
This criterion was defined in Hansen N. Benchmarking a BI-Population CMA-ES on the BBOB-2009 Function Testbed. In the workshop Proceedings of the Genetic and Evolutionary Computation Conference, GECCO, pages 23892395. ACM, 2009.

member.name: M:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.ContinuousOptimization.CovarianceMatrixAdaptation.TerminationCriteria.NoEffectCoord.IsMet(Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.ContinuousOptimization.CovarianceMatrixAdaptation.CmaEsElements)
member.summary: Checks adding a 0.2-standard deviation vector in any single coordinate does not change the distribution mean.
member.returns: Whether no change occurred in distribution mean.

member.name: M:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.ContinuousOptimization.CovarianceMatrixAdaptation.TerminationCriteria.NoEffectCoord.Restore
member.summary: Restores an object after deserialization by .
member.remarks: For example, this method might set equality definitions in dictionaries.

member.name: T:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.ContinuousOptimization.CovarianceMatrixAdaptation.TerminationCriteria.TolUpSigma
member.summary:
Termination criterion for based on divergence: Stop if the factor between current and initial step size is greater than a constant times the square root of the covariance matrix's largest eigenvalue.
This criterion was defined in Hansen N. Benchmarking a BI-Population CMA-ES on the BBOB-2009 Function Testbed. In the workshop Proceedings of the Genetic and Evolutionary Computation Conference, GECCO, pages 23892395. ACM, 2009.

member.name: F:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.ContinuousOptimization.CovarianceMatrixAdaptation.TerminationCriteria.TolUpSigma.MaxFactor
member.summary: The maximum factor which does not lead to termination.

member.summary: Checks if the factor between current and initial step size is greater than a times the square root of the covariance matrix's largest eigenvalue.

member.name: M:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.ContinuousOptimization.DifferentialEvolution.DifferentialEvolutionConfiguration.IsTechnicallyCompatible(Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.Configuration.ConfigurationBase)
member.summary:
Checks whether two s are compatible in a technical sense for one to be used in a continued run based on a run using the other.
The difference to is that this function only checks for technical compatibility and does not consider whether the combination of configurations is compatible in the sense that the continued run looks like a longer single run.
member.param: Configuration used for the start of run.
member.returns: True iff this configuration can be used for continued run.

member.name: P:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.MachineLearning.RandomForest.RandomForestTopPerformerFocus.TopPerformerFocusImpurityCalculator.IsTopPerformer
member.summary: Gets or sets an indicator if the current sample is considered to be a top performer. [i] is true, if genome i is considered to be a top performer (within the current interval). NOTE: .Length == .Length. I.e. make sure to access this array with indices from 0 to Interval.Length - 1. DO NOT USE "var i = this.Interval.FromInclusive" !!! Can be used to sepearate the elements in the current node into Top and Under-performers. Elements are presumed to be ordered by the current feature, so that a split can be defined by a single split index.

member.summary: Defines a new replacement for an (artifical) parameter. Example: It can be used for modeling special cases, such as "x = 0" disables "heuristic x", when x is a numerical parameter with a large domain. In that case call: ("xActive", false, "x", 0). Afterwards, will never contain a value for "xActive", but if "xActive == false", the defined replacement (i.e. "x = 0") will be contained in the returned dictionary. Important: The needs to be a member of the current .
member.param: The name of the indicator (=dummy) parameter that needs to be replaced. This parameter will always be removed from the genomes set of active parameters.

member.name: T:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.PopulationUpdateStrategies.DifferentialEvolution.InformationFlow.GlobalDifferentialEvolutionInformationFlow
member.summary: Defines the information flow between the overall tuning process and a instance which acts on the complete population, i.e. fixes different discrete parameters for each individual.
member.remarks: This information flow strategy has the advantage that it exchanges lots of information. On the negative side, evaluating the same continuous parameter set in combination with different discrete sets may exhibit very different performance, violating some assumptions of DE. Note that, if no discrete parameters are used, this disadvantage does not matter.

member.name: T:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.PopulationUpdateStrategies.DifferentialEvolution.InformationFlow.LocalDifferentialEvolutionInformationFlow
member.summary: Defines the information flow between the overall tuning process and a instance which concentrates on improving the incumbent, i.e. only acts on incumbent-based points.
member.remarks: Only acting on points with discrete parameters equal to those of the incumbent means that we try to find good continuous parameters for a fixed set of discrete ones. It has the advantage that it does not violate any assumptions of DE: Everything is continuous. On the negative side, such an information flow strategy means that we only exploit a single information point from prior optimization.

member.name: M:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.PopulationUpdateStrategies.StrategyConfigurationBase`1.IsTechnicallyCompatible(Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.Configuration.ConfigurationBase)
member.summary:
Checks whether two s are compatible in a technical sense for one to be used in a continued tuning based on a tuning using the other.
The difference to is that this function only checks for technical compatibility and does not consider whether the combination of configurations is compatible in the sense that the continued tuning looks like a longer single tuning.
member.param: Configuration used for the start of tuning.
member.returns: True iff this configuration can be used for continued tuning.

member.summary: Sorts the provided by performance, best first.
member.param:
The of the current mini tournament.
NOTE: If racing is enabled (i.e. --enableRacing=true), the number of finished instances per genome may vary.
NOTE: The finished instances may include results cancelled due to CPU timeouts. For those the -Boolean is true.

member.name: M:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.TargetAlgorithm.RunEvaluators.IRunEvaluator`2.GetGenomesThatCanBeCancelledByRacing(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.GenomeEvaluation.Evaluation.ImmutableGenomeStats{`0,`1}},System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets all genomes that should not be evaluated further due to racing. IMPORTANT: We strongly recommend to not cancel any target algorithm evaluations of possible mini tournament winners by racing, even if all other genome evaluations have been finished, to ensure that all mini tournament winners have seen all instances. That's why the tuner will throw an exception, if you want to cancel more genomes by racing than "number of mini tournament participants - desired number of mini tournament winners". NOTE: If racing is enabled (i.e. --enableRacing=true), implementing this method in combination with can drastically reduce the run time of the whole tuning. That's why the implementation of this method should strongly depend on the implementations of and .
member.param: The genome stats of the current mini tournament.
The desired number of mini tournament winners.
member.returns: The genomes that should not be evaluated further.

member.name: M:Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.TargetAlgorithm.RunEvaluators.IRunEvaluator`2.ComputeEvaluationPriorityOfGenome(Optano.Algorithm.Tuner.GenomeEvaluation.Evaluation.ImmutableGenomeStats{`0,`1},System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Computes the evaluation priority of the current genome, based on the given information. The lower the evaluation priority, the earlier the genome will be evaluated. NOTE: If racing is enabled (i.e. --enableRacing=true), implementing this method in combination with can drastically reduce the run time of the whole tuning. That's why the implementation of this method should strongly depend on the implementations of and .
